answers.answer: No, that is still hypo. Many good endocrinologists will know this, but some doctors still rely on outdated values. TSH is a pituitary hormone and the thryoid should be treated by measuring FT3/FT4. TSH should be secondary.The question is, "How do you feel?" If you are having hypo symptoms, the doctor may need to raise your Levo (an FT4 drug). If your FT4 levels are fine, but your FT3 levels are low, then the doctor may need to add an FT3 drug like Cytomel.:) Tamra
No I don't fell good at all, am always cold my hair is falling,fatigue,tired,long and heavy menstrual periods and other things related to hypo.

Unfortunately, so many of us get stuck with doctors who know more about treating diabetes than thyroid disease. That's what happened with me. My last doc only wanted to treat my TSH, even though I had many hypo symptoms. I had to beg her to raise my medication. We shouldn't have to beg for wellness.I switched endos using the below directory. I am VERY HAPPY with my new doc now! He treats the FreeT4/3 levels, and TSH is secondary.http://thyroid.about.com/cs/doctors/a/topdocs.htm:) Tamra

Good morning you know something I strongly beleived you are rigth, that just sound it like my Dr. The last visit after asked him 3 times and only after mentioning about my period coming twice a month thats when he increased my dose of  levoxil from 88 to100.my Female Cardiologist is showing more interets on my thyroid than my own Endo.
What were your Ft3 and FT4 levels?If my TSH was over 2.5, I'd feel like cr@p too.I'm getting mine back down at the moment as it ran away to over 7 lol.

I don't know my Ft3 or Ft4 levels last visit to Endo he did not dicussed them with me. I felt visit was rushed,he said everything was ok and only increased the meds after talking about my period. I find out that the lab can send me complementary results at home, I began to request them that way.
Post them here as soonas you know then others can comment on them too.All the best :)

question: My results came back 3.180. Is that a normal level?   I had been on levoxil for 14 years.
title: normal THS levels
